ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: between 1 and 5
one hour
1-2 but more during presentation, midterm and final weeks
1 hr
I spent about 1-2 hours per week.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Interesting course. Hard to teach "lab methods" in a lecture setting. Liked the student presentations, learned a lot from presenting.
Class was informal and informative, Dr. Yu was very knowledgeable
great course

This course provided a good overview of important topics in molecular epi. A strong background in biology and epidemiology is critical to getting the most out of the lectures since material builds off fundamental topics in these disciplines.
The course is good, but could be improved by clearer teaching objectives and more structure. Sometimes, it is a little vague what the course wants us to focus on.
Good course to introduce these concepts.
great! maybe slides can give more details about practical public health assessments instead of just outlines
I liked how Dr Yu chose articles that used the specific principles taught in the course
I was confused by this class due to the lack of feedback from the professor but the concepts were taught well.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Herbert Yu  Good instruction. Knows the material very well. Maybe the class should have a lab component? Didn't think the test reflected material learned in class well, but again hard to test and teach lab methods without doing them.
Instructor: Herbert Yu  Dr. Yu was very friendly and easygoing, answered questions well and was aware of students' understanding of material
Instructor: Herbert Yu  good teacher
Instructor: Herbert Yu  Dr. Yu was responsive to student inquiries and very knowledgeable. At times, lecture notes were difficult to follow, but overall, I enjoyed attending lectures.
Instructor: Herbert Yu  Great work!
Instructor: Herbert Yu  very helpful
Instructor: Herbert Yu  strengths: very helpful, generous with his time, very understanding
Instructor: Herbert Yu  Very informative. He was very knowledgable on the subject matter.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Alan did a nice job
good
There was limited opportunity to interact with the TA; however, he seemed to be qualified and knowledgeable in the subject area.
very helpful
n/a
We had a TA but there were no office hours and no feedback on assignments so there might as well not have been one.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Lab based methods for epidemiologists. I would recommend if the epidemiologist wants to learn more about molecular epi.
Not sure if it will be offered again, but this was a good course with Dr. Yu
a little complex for me, but useful and interesting
Overall, this is a good course for anyone who wants a broad overview of issues in molecular epi., especially methodology and study design.
n/a

if you like genetics or have research interests in the area, this is a must!if you have minimum interest, I am not sure how you will ever use this class...the skills taught are fairly specific to molecular epi, not too many general epi concepts..
The format was confusing and feedback on assignments was minimal but the concepts of molecular epi are clearly presented.
This course is a very good overview of molecular epidemiology and I would recommend it to a fellow student.
